channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Federal judge temporarily blocks Trump's National Guard deployment to Portland
item.description: A federal judge has temporarily blocked the Trump administration from deploying the National Guard to Portland, Ore., which the president had ordered over the objections of local leaders.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge has temporarily blocked the Trump administration from deploying the National Guard to Portland, Ore., which the president had ordered over the objections of local leaders.

(Image credit: Jenny Kane)
item.dc:creator: Conrad Wilson

item.title: Largest US Lutheran denomination installs first Black presiding bishop
item.description: Rev. Yehiel Curry succeeds Rev. Elizabeth Eaton, who served for 12 years and was the first woman to lead the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America.
item.content:encoded:
Rev. Yehiel Curry succeeds Rev. Elizabeth Eaton, who served for 12 years and was the first woman to lead the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America.

(Image credit: Talia Sprague)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: National parks caught in the crosshairs of government shutdown
item.description: National parks across the country face conflicting demands and uncertainty as a result of the ongoing federal funding dispute.
item.content:encoded:
National parks across the country face conflicting demands and uncertainty as a result of the ongoing federal funding dispute.

(Image credit: Robert F. Bukaty)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Trump urges Hamas to 'move quickly' on Gaza peace plan
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Saturday that he hopes Hamas will have returned all remaining hostages by Oct. 13.
item.content:encoded:
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Saturday that he hopes Hamas will have returned all remaining hostages by Oct. 13.

(Image credit: Eyad Baba)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: Populist billionaire Andrej Babiš wins Czech parliamentary election
item.description: His political comeback put the country on a course away from supporting Ukraine and toward Hungary and Slovakia, which have taken a pro-Russian path.
item.content:encoded:
His political comeback put the country on a course away from supporting Ukraine and toward Hungary and Slovakia, which have taken a pro-Russian path.

(Image credit: Petr David Josek)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Time is short for an ACA premium fix in the shutdown fight, says GOP insurance leader
item.description: After warning Congress for months about premium spikes, the leader of the country's insurance commissioners — a Republican from North Dakota — says he's hopeful there could be a last minute fix.
item.content:encoded:
After warning Congress for months about premium spikes, the leader of the country's insurance commissioners — a Republican from North Dakota — says he's hopeful there could be a last minute fix.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: Opinion: Jane Goodall helped humans understand their place in the world
item.description: Jane Goodall, the influential primatologist and conservationist, died this week at the age of 91. NPR's Scott Simon reflects on her legacy and love for chimpanzees.
item.content:encoded:
Jane Goodall, the influential primatologist and conservationist, died this week at the age of 91. NPR's Scott Simon reflects on her legacy and love for chimpanzees.

(Image credit: Bela Szandelszky)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: As U.S. pressure mounts, Venezuela's foreign 'hostages' face growing uncertainty
item.description: Dozens of foreign nationals are locked up in Venezuelan prisons, accused of crimes they may not have committed. As the U.S. ramps up pressure on Caracas, families fear for their loved ones stuck there.
item.content:encoded:
Dozens of foreign nationals are locked up in Venezuelan prisons, accused of crimes they may not have committed. As the U.S. ramps up pressure on Caracas, families fear for their loved ones stuck there.

(Image credit: Ariana Cubillos)
item.dc:creator: Manuel Rueda

item.title: Here's how the fashion industry is using AI to predict the next big trend
item.description: Once the province of elite fashion editors and forecasters, the art of figuring out what's likely to fly off future racks is getting an assist from AI algorithms.
item.content:encoded:
Once the province of elite fashion editors and forecasters, the art of figuring out what's likely to fly off future racks is getting an assist from AI algorithms.

(Image credit: Kiran Ridley; Olga Gasnier; Geoffroy Van Der Hasselt/AFP via Getty Images; Julien De Rosa/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Lou Ye's acclaimed 'An Unfinished Film' remains unfinished
item.description: Chinese director Lou Ye's An Unfinished Film is not a masterpiece, but why do so many seem to demand it to be?
item.content:encoded:
An Unfinished Film.'/>

Chinese director Lou Ye's An Unfinished Film is not a masterpiece, but why do so many seem to demand it to be?

(Image credit: Yingfilms Pte. Ltd., Essential Filmproduktion GmbH)
item.dc:creator: Yangyang Cheng
